title: IEM Katowice

embed.description: All teams are now known and we're excited to be able to announce the groups for the tournament - who will rise? We are pleased to announce the groups for League of Legends at the Intel Extreme Masters World Championship in Katowice, with the first matches set to take place at the Spodek arena on March the 13th.

body:
Looking at the Groups, and the format (ugh Best of 1 double elimination).

I think this setup tries to favor Western teams, but does not seem to be offering a truely skill based spectacle. I'll watch it, but I worry about experience that teams will get. 

At worst, a team will play two games and go home.  Showing nothing of what they can likely do.

I think of group stages as Two Game Round Robin (Each team plays each other team twice). This is like a mini-mindless playoff before the actual playoff.

replies.body: I agree it should've been a two game round robin. Then we could've seen who were the better teams more accurately. If nothing else, it should've at least been a best of 3 since there are only eight teams.
Poor C9, was kind of wanting SK vs C9 but oh well.

It's double elimination so after SK lose to Yao Flash Wolves they can face C9 :3

Also, if c9 or SK can make it through the loser's bracket they can at least make it to the semi finals. Maybe a c9 v GMB or a SK v TSM! >.> the possibilities.
